description: The name of a legendary wizard from fantasy literature, often accompanies heroes on their adventures.
The mythical sword of King Arthur, pulled from the stone.
A race known from stronghold Khazad-dum.
Creatures living in Mirkwood in Tolkien's world.
A character from 'The Witcher', Geralt's best friend, a bard.
A mysterious ring that Frodo must destroy.
The great dragon guarding treasure in 'The Hobbit'.
A dwarven city in Middle-earth.
A wizard in white robes in the Middle-earth universe.
Magical beings guarding hidden treasures in 'Harry Potter'.
The magical school for wizards in J.K. Rowling's world.
A three-headed dragon from 'A Song of Ice and Fire'.
An elf archer from the Fellowship of the Ring.
Powerful creatures from Norse mythology.
A land full of dragons and magic, created by George R.R. Martin.
Magical creatures guarding the Gringotts Bank.
The most powerful beings in 'The Lord of the Rings', controlled by Sauron.
A powerful ring in Norse mythology that always returns.
A race known for their longevity and great wisdom in fantasy worlds.
The place where the Iron Throne resides in 'A Song of Ice and Fire'.
The main hero's name in 'Skyrim'.
A race of direwolves from 'Game of Thrones'.
A magical material used to forge swords in 'Game of Thrones'.
The name of Aragorn in 'The Lord of the Rings' before his identity was revealed.
The magical sword of Geralt of Rivia.
Mythical dragons from Chinese mythology that control the weather.
The source of magical power in 'Diablo'.
The name of the powerful wizard who created horcruxes.
The greatest enemy of the Dragonborn in 'Skyrim'.
A mysterious land from 'Narnia', visited by four siblings.
An elven princess from Rivendell.
An elven city from 'The Lord of the Rings'.
The legendary trees that provided light to Valinor.
The land located beyond the Eastern Wall in 'A Song of Ice and Fire'.
Dangerous marshes in Middle-earth.
The place of the final battle between Norse gods and giants.
The mysterious place where the sword of Gryphon lies.
The mountain where Frodo destroyed the ring.
The Lady of the Lake in Arthurian mythology.
An order of knights defending Valinor.
Guardians of the Land of the Dead in Egyptian mythology.
The name of a young sorceress from 'The Witcher' series.
An order of knowledge seekers in 'The Witcher'.
The seat of House Lannister in 'A Song of Ice and Fire'.
A city in 'Elder Scrolls', known as the heart of Tamriel.
A creature from Greek mythology that turns everything to stone.
A magical tree in Tolkien's universe.
An infinite tower in Stephen King's 'The Dark Tower'.
A powerful wizard in red robes from 'Conan the Barbarian'.
